comments:
build N0222

With several (3) java editors open I:
- selected some text and use the menu Copy command (because ctrl-c does not 
seem to work)
- then reposition my cursor in the SAME editor and hit ctrl-v
- the paste does not appear to work however, on closer inspection of ANOTHER 
editor, I find my text inserted there!

marking as major both because the ctrl keys to not seem to work correctly and 
because of potential data corruption issues with pasting text at random.

- anything in .log?
- reproducible?
- is this the only key binding which is not working?
- do you see the shortcut (Ctrl+C) in the menu?

- very reproducable.  In fact, it has become quite a problem.  It even happens 
now when I am in the Team Sync perspective and commands in the compare view are 
actually carried out on some random editor which is open in my Java Browsing 
perspective in another window!!

- alot of ctrl things do not work but it is sort of random.  ctrl-s is 
intermittent.  ctrl-arrow generally does not work, I've had cases where ctrl-v 
worked but then did not.

- The shortcuts do appear.  (the save ctrl-s may not be everywhere it should. I 
remember thinking ti was missing but don't remember where)

- forgot the log entries.  The following appears in the log repeatedly

This looks like a key binding and activation problem in the UI.
Are you reusing editors (Workbench > Editors > )?

I don't see anything on that prefs page that talks about reusing editors.  As 
far as I know I did not change any editor prefs.

I'm going to take a wild stab and say this is not a key bindings problem.  :) 
 
The stack trace indicates a problem in the JavaEditor.PreviousSubWordAction.  
The offending lines are  
 
	final ISourceViewer viewer= getSourceViewer(); 
	final IDocument document= viewer.getDocument(); 
 
where "viewer" is null.  This appears to only be possible if the editor has 
been disposed, but still receives a key event.  How could this happen?

Agree that the stack trace shows a problem in the PreviousSubWord action.
However, I would expect that the key binding support code is protected i.e. does
not disable many other commands as reported by this PR ;-)

The main problems seems to be the activation. But both problems might be caused
by some previous error.
i can easily reproduce this using M7 plus platform-ui from head. i will investigate now..

Jeff McAffer showed me a reproduced case with no stack traces in the log.  The 
stack trace may be a red herring.  Some, but not all key bindings are affected.  
His steps were: 
1.) Open workbench 
2.) Open editor -- key bindings work fine 
3.) Close editor 
4.) Switch editor -- key bindings are messed up  
 
Things I can think of: 
1.) Contexts not getting switched (seems like it would have different symptoms) 
2.) Handlers not getting switched (old handler holding reference to an old 
editor -- possibly closed) 
3.) A step during editor activation is missed (updating one of many 
references)?

ok. i just had lunch.. *now* i'm looking at it.. steps to reproduce from clean runtime workbench:
1. new java project TestProject
2. new class Test1
3. new class Test2
4. copy from the Test2 editor
5. switch to the Test1 editor and paste

not to be persnicketty (sp?) but this is very dangerous.  I have several times 
been pasting away (with it silently pasting into other files) and then saved 
the other files that had the bogus changes.  It took me some time to unravel 
these changes and get back to a sane state.  

If this is in today's I build, it is very *dangerous*.

I'm upgrading to "critical" as this causes "loss of data". 
 
Chris: 
1.) Is this in today's integration build? 
2.) Will we have a fix in time for a rebuild tomorrow morning?
i have isolated this problem. it is my fault. i will have a fix shortly..
Thanks.  I'm going to post to platform-releng-dev asking for a rebuild.
*** Bug 52981 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 52975 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

reopening this bug as Jeff has found that on the I20040225 build the following 
scenario does not work:

1) Open two workbench windows
2) open editors in both workbenches
2.1) give the second (newer) workbench window focus
3) in the second workbench window give the editor focus and press Ctrl+F4

Note that the editor closed is in the first workbench window.

The problem you describe has been captured in Bug 53076.  It is a separate, 
though related problem.  It's best to leave this bug closed.  Please listen to 
Bug 53076 if you are interested in window switching.
